title: ASReview 0.19 RIS export error: "float object is not iterable"
body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/asreview/asreview/discussions/988
Originally posted by **jaohls** February 22, 2022 Hi there all you excellent ASReview people, Stumbled upon this problem - a colleague in my team cannot export to RIS file after screening ~25 % of the data. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96236396/155088009-363610db-f3d7-4252-a0dc-9e9088b1ef1b.png) Export to CSV and Excel formats seem to work. Uploaded the .asreview project file in question here: https://drive.protonmail.com/urls/NTB1H2V6QG#tQ68AB753Apx
Steps to reproduce the issue: ``` from asreview import ASReviewData asr_data = ASReviewData.from_file("Ny_uten_dupl_MR_Eksport.txt").to_ris("test_export.ris") ``` Output ``` Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> from asreview import ASReviewData >>> >>> asr_data = ASReviewData.from_file("Ny_uten_dupl_MR_Eksport.txt").to_ris("test_export.ris") Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "/Users/xxx/Documents/GitHub/asreview/asreview/data/base.py", line 489, in to_ris return write_ris(df, fp) File "/Users/xxx/Documents/GitHub/asreview/asreview/io/ris_writer.py", line 102, in write_ris rispy.dump(records_new, fp) File "/opt/homebrew/Caskroom/miniforge/base/envs/asreview_m1_2/lib/python3.9/site-packages/rispy/writer.py", line 185, in dump text = dumps(references, implementation=implementation, **kw) File "/opt/homebrew/Caskroom/miniforge/base/envs/asreview_m1_2/lib/python3.9/site-packages/rispy/writer.py", line 208, in dumps return writer(**kw).formats(references) File "/opt/homebrew/Caskroom/miniforge/base/envs/asreview_m1_2/lib/python3.9/site-packages/rispy/writer.py", line 145, in formats return "\n".join(lines) File "/opt/homebrew/Caskroom/miniforge/base/envs/asreview_m1_2/lib/python3.9/site-packages/rispy/writer.py", line 138, in _format_all_references lines_ref = self._format_reference(ref, count=i + 1) File "/opt/homebrew/Caskroom/miniforge/base/envs/asreview_m1_2/lib/python3.9/site-packages/rispy/writer.py", line 123, in _format_reference for val_i in value: TypeError: 'float' object is not iterable ``` It looks to me like there is a `np.nan` send to `rispy`, however it should be `None`. @ottomattas
